I nominated this game in the Most sequel-deserving category.
Have fun crying about another in-game character at the end.

As a sequel to Half-Life 2, one of the best first person shooters ever made, it doesn't let down. It advances the story and adds many of the most memorable moments in all the games of the Half-Life saga. Sadly it's also the last one and leaves the story unfinished. Still a must play.

ĞĞµ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¹Ğ¼Ñƒ ĞºÑƒĞ´Ğ° Ğ‘Ğ°Ñ€Ğ½Ğ¸ Ğ´ĞµĞ»ÑÑ, Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ´Ğ° Ğ»Ğ°Ğ´Ğ½Ğ¾.

I nominated this game for the write-in award with "This Game Deserves A Sequel."

You might think that is a crappy thing to do, maybe I'm hoping on the bandwagon and wasting my votes for a game that will never see a sequel, or worse yet, I'm influencing the developers at Valve to never engage in making a sequel because the more I assist in shoving this unwanted child in Gabe's face the more he denies it and wishes it wasn't born.

Whatever the case n one can argue when the hype for the release of a sequel to this game was high there was a bit of fear and euphoria in everyone that took part in playing and waiting.

The game Half-Life 2 would go to make a mark on a generation and be so impactful on the industry as a whole that it is still whispered about in meme circles and forums from Reddit to small collective communities. We all halt whatever we are doing when a "leak" occurs just to reassure ourselves if it is real or not, and with the retiring of Marc Laidlaw and his subsequent publishing of what seemed to be a script that was abandoned by the main developers and was his vision on how to end the series, we all seem to have a feeling of true acceptance that this game series is lost.

So in reality, this is my way of expressing my feelings about the whole ordeal and wishing it was different.

GAME THAT DESERVES A SEQUEL!

I'd say it's better overall than Episode One, but the last mission is awful to play and is the reason as to why I never really bothered replaying it. The game is still a good continuation of Episode One and has more stuff going on than the former, which makes it more memorable. I'd recommend both episodes to people who enjoyed the original Half-Life 2, though I still think that the original game is the best one by far.
